channel.title: CVE Feed for HCL -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for HCL -- all products

item.title: CVE-2019-4209|2024-08-04T19:33:37.903Z -- hcl -- hcl%20connections
item.description: HCL Connections v5.5, v6.0, and v6.5 contains an open redirect vulnerability which could be exploited by an attacker to conduct phishing attacks.

item.title: CVE-2020-14258|2024-08-04T12:39:36.207Z -- hcl -- hcl%20notes
item.description: HCL Notes is susceptible to a Denial of Service vulnerability caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted email message to hang the client. Versions 9, 10 and 11 are affected.

item.title: CVE-2020-4104|2024-08-04T07:52:20.943Z -- hcl -- hcl%20bigfix%20webui
item.description: HCL BigFix WebUI is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS) within the Apps->Software module. An attacker can use XSS to send a malicious script to an unsuspecting user. This affects all versions prior to latest releases as specified in https://support.hcltechsw.com/csm?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0080855&sys_kb_id=971d99ed1b8ed01c086dcbfc0a4bcb6a.

item.title: CVE-2019-4388|2024-08-04T19:33:37.941Z -- hcl -- appscan%20source
item.description: HCL AppScan Source 9.0.3.13 and earlier is susceptible to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks by allowing users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI.

item.title: CVE-2020-14230|2024-08-04T12:39:36.209Z -- hcl -- hcl%20domino
item.description: HCL Domino is susceptible to a Denial of Service vulnerability caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted email message to hang the server. Versions previous to releases 9.0.1 FP10 IF6, 10.0.1 FP5 and 11.0.1 are affected.

item.title: CVE-2019-4409|2024-08-04T19:33:38.071Z -- hcl -- hcl%20traveler
item.description: HCL Traveler versions 9.x and earlier are susceptible to cross-site scripting attacks. On the Problem Report page of the Traveler servlet pages, there is a field to specify a file attachment to provide additional problem details. An invalid file name returns an error message that includes the entered file name. If the file name is not escaped in the returned error page, it could expose a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2020-4089|2024-08-04T07:52:20.997Z -- hcl -- hcl%20notes
item.description: HCL Notes is vulnerable to an information leakage vulnerability through its support for the 'mailto' protocol. This vulnerability could result in files from the user's filesystem or connected network filesystems being leaked to a third party. All versions of HCL Notes 9, 10 and 11 are affected.

item.title: CVE-2020-14234|2024-08-04T12:39:36.217Z -- hcl -- hcl%20domino
item.description: HCL Domino is susceptible to a Denial of Service vulnerability due to improper validation of user-supplied input, potentially giving an attacker the ability to crash the server. Versions previous to release 9.0.1 FP10 IF6 and release 10.0.1 are affected.
